When I try setting up credentials for a HTML-login on some page I have a problem with the first seed not getting crawled.

I have 2 seeds:
http://www.foo.dk/
http://www.foo.dk/seed2.html

The top of the crawl-log goes:
2007-08-07T09:05:01.510Z     1         52 dns:www.foo.dk P http://www.foo.dk/ text/dns #014 20070807090500909+76 
sha1:ZFEUC72STTHW6WGT3CQ7FSC5ZELHUCDG - -
2007-08-07T09:05:01.920Z   200          0 http://www.foo.dk/robots.txt P http://www.foo.dk/ text/plain #003 20070807090501840+75 
sha1:3I42H3S6NNFQ2MSVX7XZKYAYSCX5QBYJ - -
2007-08-07T09:05:02.234Z   -50          - http://www.foo.dk/ - - no-type #014 - - - 3t
2007-08-07T09:05:02.481Z   200         88 http://www.foo.dk/login.asp P http://www.arto.dk/ text/html #001 20070807090502240+221 
sha1:3KZ4VXNSIFLJTECHCFGTXFRCPCNDOZAZ - -
2007-08-07T09:05:03.276Z   200      31157 http://www.foo.dk/seed2.html - - text/html #041 20070807090502792+82 
sha1:5RKIJVDCIFWGCCYH73GXG6TGL6LIYT7F - -

And the crawler does the login - finds out that the login-page is a prerequisit (P) to the first seed

But the first seed never gets retried after the login - ends with status-code (-50)

If I add a dummy seed to the top of the seed-list things seem to work. But does the crawler guarentee that the order of seeds in the 
seed-list is always the crawling-order ?

If my seedlist have only the first seed the crawler stops after the login-page no matter what

best
--
